ch.unige.ng.ops.guided
Interface GuidedSelector<T extends Individual>

All Known Implementing Classes:
BestSelector, KTournamentSelector, MultipleSelector, RandomSelector, WorstBiggerSelector
public interface GuidedSelector<T extends Individual>

The goal of this class is to work like a selector, but the class has an argument in input, to know how to select next individuals

Version:
28 avr. 2005
Author:
Jacques Fontignie

Method Summary
 void select(IGroup<T> p, Context context, T[] destination, int number, SelectionEvaluator<T> evaluator)
          Select a number of Individual from a OldPopulation

Very importantThe function has to return the individual itself..
 

Method Detail

select

void select(IGroup<T> p,
            Context context,
            T[] destination,
            int number,
            SelectionEvaluator<T> evaluator)
Select a number of Individual from a OldPopulation

Very importantThe function has to return the individual itself.. Classes using it have to create copies

Parameters:
p - the population.
context - The context of the population
destination - is the population, in which selected individuals will not be put. These elements have to be refereneces of p
number - The number of individuals we want to select
evaluator -
